AffineTransform getType	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Method returns type of affine transformation. Transform matrix is   m00 m01 m02   m10 m11 m12 According analytic geometry new basis vectors are (m00, m01) and (m10, m11), translation vector is (m02, m12). Original basis vectors are (1, 0) and (0, 1). Type transformations classification: <ul><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/geom/AffineTransform.html#TYPE_IDENTITY"><code>TYPE_IDENTITY</code></a> - new basis equals original one and zero translation</li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/geom/AffineTransform.html#TYPE_TRANSLATION"><code>TYPE_TRANSLATION</code></a> - translation vector isn't zero</li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/geom/AffineTransform.html#TYPE_UNIFORM_SCALE"><code>TYPE_UNIFORM_SCALE</code></a> - vectors length of new basis equals</li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/geom/AffineTransform.html#TYPE_GENERAL_SCALE"><code>TYPE_GENERAL_SCALE</code></a> - vectors length of new basis doesn't equal</li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/geom/AffineTransform.html#TYPE_FLIP"><code>TYPE_FLIP</code></a> - new basis vector orientation differ from original one</li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/geom/AffineTransform.html#TYPE_QUADRANT_ROTATION"><code>TYPE_QUADRANT_ROTATION</code></a> - new basis is rotated by 90, 180, 270, or 360 degrees</li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/geom/AffineTransform.html#TYPE_GENERAL_ROTATION"><code>TYPE_GENERAL_ROTATION</code></a> - new basis is rotated by arbitrary angle</li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/geom/AffineTransform.html#TYPE_GENERAL_TRANSFORM"><code>TYPE_GENERAL_TRANSFORM</code></a> - transformation can't be inversed</li></ul></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/geom/AffineTransform.html#getType--
AffineTransform	A										<section class="prog__container"><p></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/geom/AffineTransform.html

You can specify an alphabet and convert an integer into the corresponding alphabet number representation. Background	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A specialized class holding configurable properties related to an IElement's background. This class is meant to be used as the value for the Property.BACKGROUND key in an IPropertyContainer. Allows to define a background color, and positive or negative changes to the location of the edges of the background coloring.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/property/Background.html

BarcodeDataMatrix setHeight	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the height of the barcode. If the height is zero it will be calculated. This height doesn't include the whitespace border, if any. <p></p> The allowed dimensions are (height, width):<p> 10, 10<br> 12, 12<br> 8, 18<br> 14, 14<br> 8, 32<br> 16, 16<br> 12, 26<br> 18, 18<br> 20, 20<br> 12, 36<br> 22, 22<br> 16, 36<br> 24, 24<br> 26, 26<br> 16, 48<br> 32, 32<br> 36, 36<br> 40, 40<br> 44, 44<br> 48, 48<br> 52, 52<br> 64, 64<br> 72, 72<br> 80, 80<br> 88, 88<br> 96, 96<br> 104, 104<br> 120, 120<br> 132, 132<br> 144, 144<br/></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/barcodes/BarcodeDataMatrix.html#setHeight-int-

BarcodeDataMatrix getOptions	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Gets the barcode options.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/barcodes/BarcodeDataMatrix.html#getOptions--
BarcodeDataMatrix setOptions	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the options for the barcode generation. The options can be:<p> One of:<br><code>DM_AUTO</code> - the best encodation will be used<br><code>DM_ASCII</code> - ASCII encodation<br><code>DM_C40</code> - C40 encodation<br><code>DM_TEXT</code> - TEXT encodation<br><code>DM_B256</code> - binary encodation<br><code>DM_X21</code> - X21 encodation<br><code>DM_EDIFACT</code> - EDIFACT encodation<br><code>DM_RAW</code> - no encodation. The bytes provided are already encoded and will be added directly to the barcode, using padding if needed. It assumes that the encodation state is left at ASCII after the last byte.<br><p></p> One of:<br><code>DM_EXTENSION</code> - allows extensions to be embedded at the start of the text:<p> exxxxxx - ECI number xxxxxx<br> m5 - macro 5<br> m6 - macro 6<br> f - FNC1<br> saabbccccc - Structured Append, aa symbol position (1-16), bb total number of symbols (2-16), ccccc file identification (0-64515)<br> p - Reader programming<br> . - extension terminator<p> Example for a structured append, symbol 2 of 6, with FNC1 and ECI 000005. The actual text is "Hello".<p> s020600075fe000005.Hello<p> One of:<br><code>DM_TEST</code> - doesn't generate the image but returns all the other information.</br></p></p></p></br></br></br></br></br></br></p></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/barcodes/BarcodeDataMatrix.html#setOptions-int-

BarcodeInter25	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Implements the code interleaved 2 of 5. The text can include non numeric characters that are printed but do not generate bars. The default parameters are:  x = 0.8f; n = 2; font = new PdfType1Font(document, new TYPE_1_FONT(FontConstants.HELVETICA, PdfEncodings.WINANSI)); size = 8; baseline = size; barHeight = size * 3; textAlignment = ALIGN_CENTER; generateChecksum = false; checksumText = false; </p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/barcodes/BarcodeInter25.html

BlockElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A BlockElement will try to take up as much horizontal space as available to it on the canvas or page. BlockRenderer layout	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from interface: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/IRenderer.html#layout-com.itextpdf.layout.layout.LayoutContext-">IRenderer</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">This method simulates positioning of the renderer, including all of its children, and returns the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>LayoutResult</code></a>, representing the layout result, including occupied area, status, i.e. if there was enough place to fit the renderer subtree, etc. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>LayoutResult</code></a> can be extended to return custom layout results for custom elements, e.g. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/TextRenderer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.renderer"><code>TextRenderer</code></a> uses <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/TextLayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>TextLayoutResult</code></a> as its result. Border draw	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><p> All borders are supposed to be drawn in such way, that inner content of the element is on the right from the drawing direction. Borders are drawn in this order: top, right, bottom, left. </p><p> Given points specify the line which lies on the border of the content area, therefore the border itself should be drawn to the left from the drawing direction. </p><p><code>borderWidthBefore</code> and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> parameters are used to define the widths of the borders that are before and after the current border, e.g. for the bottom border, <code>borderWidthBefore</code> specifies width of the right border and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> - width of the left border. Those width are used to handle areas of border joins. </p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/border/Border.html#draw-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.PdfCanvas-float-float-float-float-float-float-

Although not completely necessary in all cases, it is still recommended to call this method when you are done working with <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/Canvas.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout"><code>Canvas</code></a> object, as due to some properties set there might be some 'hanging' elements, which are waiting other elements to be added and processed. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/Canvas.html#close--"><code>close()</code></a> tells the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/Canvas.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout"><code>Canvas</code></a> that no more elements will be added and it is time to finish processing all the elements.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/Canvas.html#close--

CanvasTag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This class represents a single tag on a single piece of marked content.  In Tagged PDF, a tag is the basic structure unit for marking content. CFFFont getCID	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">get a single CID font. The PDF architecture (1.4) supports 16-bit strings only with CID CFF fonts, not in Type-1 CFF fonts, so we convert the font to CID if it is in the Type-1 format. CFFFontSubset countEntireIndexRange	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Function computes the size of an index</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/font/CFFFontSubset.html#countEntireIndexRange-int-
CFFFontSubset	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This Class subsets a CFF Type Font. The subset is preformed for CID fonts and NON CID fonts. The Charstring is subsetted for both types. For CID fonts only the FDArray which are used are embedded. The Lsubroutines of the FDArrays used are subsetted as well. The Subroutine subset supports both Type1 and Type2 formatting although only tested on Type2 Format. For Non CID the Lsubroutines are subsetted. On both types the Gsubroutines is subsetted. A font which was not of CID type is transformed into CID as a part of the subset process. The CID synthetic creation was written by Sivan Toledo (sivan@math.tau.ac.il)</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/font/CFFFontSubset.html
CharVector clear	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Reset length of vector, but don't clear contents.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/hyphenation/CharVector.html#clear--

CompareTool compareByCatalog	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Compares two PDF documents by content starting from Catalog dictionary and then recursively comparing corresponding objects which are referenced from it. You can roughly imagine it as depth-first traversal of the two trees that represent pdf objects structure of the documents. <br/><br/> The main difference between this method and the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareByContent-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-"><code>compareByContent(String, String, String, String)</code></a> methods is the return value. This method returns a <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.CompareResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.utils"><code>CompareTool.CompareResult</code></a> class instance, which could be used in code, however compareByContent methods in case of the differences simply return String value, which could only be printed. Also, keep in mind that this method doesn't perform visual comparison of the documents. <br/><br/> For more explanations about what is outDoc and cmpDoc see last paragraph of the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.utils"><code>CompareTool</code></a> class description.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareByCatalog-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-
CompareTool disableCachedPagesComparison	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Disables the default logic of pages comparison. This option makes sense only for <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareByCatalog-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>compareByCatalog(PdfDocument, PdfDocument)</code></a> method. <p> By default, pages are treated as special objects and if they are met in the process of comparison, then they are not checked as objects, but rather simply checked that they has same page numbers in both documents. This behaviour is intended for the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareByContent-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-"><code>compareByContent(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String)</code></a> set of methods, because in them documents are compared in page by page basis. Thus, we don't need to check if pages are of the same content when they are met in comparison process, we are sure that we will compare their content or we have already compared them. <p> However, if you would use <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareByCatalog-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>compareByCatalog(com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument, com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument)</code></a> with default behaviour of pages comparison, pages won't be checked at all, every time when reference to the page dictionary is met, only page numbers will be compared for both documents. You can say that in this case, comparison will be performed for all document's catalog entries except /Pages (However in fact, document's page tree structures will be compared, but pages themselves - won't).</p></p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#disableCachedPagesComparison--
CompareTool setCompareByContentErrorsLimit	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the maximum errors count which will be returned as the result of the comparison.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#setCompareByContentErrorsLimit-int-

CompareTool getOutReaderProperties	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Documents for comparison are opened in reader mode. This method is intended to alter <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/ReaderProperties.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf"><code>ReaderProperties</code></a> which are used to open output document. This is particularly useful for comparison of encrypted documents. <p> For more explanations about what is outDoc and cmpDoc see last paragraph of the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.utils"><code>CompareTool</code></a> class description.</p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#getOutReaderProperties--

CompareTool compareVisually	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Compares two documents visually. For the comparison two external tools are used: Ghostscript and ImageMagick. For more info about needed configuration for visual comparison process see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.utils"><code>CompareTool</code></a> class description. <br/> During comparison for every page of two documents an image file will be created in the folder specified by outPath absolute path. Then those page images will be compared and if there are any differences for some pages, another image file will be created with marked differences on it.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareVisually-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-
CompareTool compareVisually	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Compares two documents visually. For the comparison two external tools are used: Ghostscript and ImageMagick. For more info about needed configuration for visual comparison process see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.utils"><code>CompareTool</code></a> class description. <br/> During comparison for every page of two documents an image file will be created in the folder specified by outPath absolute path. Then those page images will be compared and if there are any differences for some pages, another image file will be created with marked differences on it. <br/> It is possible to ignore certain areas of the document pages during visual comparison. This is useful for example in case if documents should be the same except certain page area with date on it. In this case, in the folder specified by the outPath, new pdf documents will be created with the black rectangles at the specified ignored areas, and visual comparison will be performed on these new documents.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareVisually-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.util.Map-
CompareTool compareByContent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Compares two PDF documents by content starting from page dictionaries and then recursively comparing corresponding objects which are referenced from them. You can roughly imagine it as depth-first traversal of the two trees that represent pdf objects structure of the documents. <br/><br/> Unlike <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareByCatalog-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>compareByCatalog(PdfDocument, PdfDocument)</code></a> this method performs content comparison page by page and doesn't compare the tag structure, acroforms and all other things that doesn't belong to specific pages. <br/> When comparison by content is finished, if any differences were found, visual comparison is automatically started. For more info see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareVisually-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-"><code>compareVisually(String, String, String, String)</code></a>. <br/><br/> For more explanations about what is outPdf and cmpPdf see last paragraph of the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.utils"><code>CompareTool</code></a> class description.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareByContent-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-

These xml files are compared if they are equal.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareTagStructures-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-
CompareTool	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This class provides means to compare two PDF files both by content and visually and gives the report of their differences.  For visual comparison it uses external tools: Ghostscript and ImageMagick, which should be installed on your machine. To allow CompareTool to use them, you need to pass either java properties or environment variables with names "gsExec" and "compareExec", which would contain the paths to the executables of correspondingly Ghostscript and ImageMagick tools.  CompareTool class was mainly designed for the testing purposes of iText in order to ensure that the same code produces the same PDF document. For this reason you will often encounter such parameter names as "outDoc" and "cmpDoc" which stand for output document and document-for-comparison. The first one is viewed as the current result, and the second one is referred as normal or ideal result. OutDoc is compared to the ideal cmpDoc. Therefore all reports of the comparison are in the form: "Expected ..., but was ...". This should be interpreted in the following way: "expected" part stands for the content of the cmpDoc and "but was" part stands for the content of the outDoc.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html
CompressionConstants	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Compression constants for PdfStream.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/CompressionConstants.html

Therefore atIdx shall not be 0.</br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/font/otf/ContextualSubstRule.html#isGlyphMatchesInput-int-int-

CRLVerifier verify	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Verifies if a a valid CRL is found for the certificate. DashedBorder draw	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><p> All borders are supposed to be drawn in such way, that inner content of the element is on the right from the drawing direction. Borders are drawn in this order: top, right, bottom, left. </p><p> Given points specify the line which lies on the border of the content area, therefore the border itself should be drawn to the left from the drawing direction. </p><p><code>borderWidthBefore</code> and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> parameters are used to define the widths of the borders that are before and after the current border, e.g. for the bottom border, <code>borderWidthBefore</code> specifies width of the right border and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> - width of the left border. Those width are used to handle areas of border joins. </p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/border/DashedBorder.html#draw-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.PdfCanvas-float-float-float-float-float-float-

Document	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Document is the default root element when creating a self-sufficient PDF. It mainly operates high-level operations e.g. setting page size and rotation, adding elements, and writing text at specific coordinates. It has no knowledge of the actual PDF concepts and syntax.  A Document's rendering behavior can be modified by extending DocumentRenderer and setting an instance of this newly created with setRenderer(com.itextpdf.layout.renderer.DocumentRenderer).</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/Document.html

DottedBorder draw	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><p> All borders are supposed to be drawn in such way, that inner content of the element is on the right from the drawing direction. Borders are drawn in this order: top, right, bottom, left. </p><p> Given points specify the line which lies on the border of the content area, therefore the border itself should be drawn to the left from the drawing direction. </p><p><code>borderWidthBefore</code> and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> parameters are used to define the widths of the borders that are before and after the current border, e.g. for the bottom border, <code>borderWidthBefore</code> specifies width of the right border and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> - width of the left border. Those width are used to handle areas of border joins. </p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/border/DottedBorder.html#draw-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.PdfCanvas-float-float-float-float-float-float-

Some fonts may specify kern pairs, i.e. pair of glyphs, between which the amount of horizontal space is adjusted. EncryptionProperties setStandardEncryption	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the encryption options for the document. The userPassword and the ownerPassword can be null or have zero length. In this case the ownerPassword is replaced by a random string. The open permissions for the document can be ALLOW_PRINTING, ALLOW_MODIFY_CONTENTS, ALLOW_COPY, ALLOW_MODIFY_ANNOTATIONS, ALLOW_FILL_IN, ALLOW_SCREENREADERS, ALLOW_ASSEMBLY and ALLOW_DEGRADED_PRINTING. An array of one or more public certificates must be provided together with an array of the same size for the permissions for each certificate. The open permissions for the document can be AllowPrinting, AllowModifyContents, AllowCopy, AllowModifyAnnotations, AllowFillIn, AllowScreenReaders, AllowAssembly and AllowDegradedPrinting. The permissions can be combined by ORing them. Optionally DO_NOT_ENCRYPT_METADATA can be ORed to output the metadata in cleartext See <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/EncryptionConstants.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf"><code>EncryptionConstants</code></a>.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/EncryptionProperties.html#setPublicKeyEncryption-java.security.cert.Certificate:A-int:A-int-

FilteredEventListener attachEventListener	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Attaches another <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/parser/listener/IEventListener.html" title="interface in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.parser.listener"><code>IEventListener</code></a> delegate with its filters. When all the filters attached to the delegate for an event accept the event, the event will be passed on to the delegate. You can attach multiple delegates to this <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/parser/listener/FilteredEventListener.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.parser.listener"><code>FilteredEventListener</code></a> instance. The content stream will be parsed just once, so it is better for performance than creating multiple <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/parser/listener/FilteredEventListener.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.parser.listener"><code>FilteredEventListener</code></a> instances and parsing the content stream multiple times. This is useful, for instance, when you want to extract content from multiple regions of a page.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/parser/listener/FilteredEventListener.html#attachEventListener-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.parser.listener.IEventListener-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.parser.filter.IEventFilter:A-

FontProgramFactory createFont	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a new font. This will always be the default Helvetica font (not embedded). This method is introduced because Helvetica is used in many examples.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/font/FontProgramFactory.html#createFont--
FontProgramFactory createFont	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a new font. This font can be one of the 14 built in types, a Type1 font referred to by an AFM or PFM file, a TrueType font (simple or collection) or a CJK font from the Adobe Asian Font Pack. TrueType fonts and CJK fonts can have an optional style modifier appended to the name. These modifiers are: Bold, Italic and BoldItalic. An example would be "STSong-Light,Bold". Note that this modifiers do not work if the font is embedded. Fonts in TrueType collections are addressed by index such as "msgothic.ttc,1". This would get the second font (indexes start at 0), in this case "MS PGothic". <p></p> The fonts are cached and if they already exist they are extracted from the cache, not parsed again. <p></p> Besides the common encodings described by name, custom encodings can also be made. These encodings will only work for the single byte fonts Type1 and TrueType. The encoding string starts with a '#' followed by "simple" or "full". If "simple" there is a decimal for the first character position and then a list of hex values representing the Unicode codes that compose that encoding.<br> The "simple" encoding is recommended for TrueType fonts as the "full" encoding risks not matching the character with the right glyph if not done with care.<br> The "full" encoding is specially aimed at Type1 fonts where the glyphs have to be described by non standard names like the Tex math fonts. Each group of three elements compose a code position: the one byte code order in decimal or as 'x' (x cannot be the space), the name and the Unicode character used to access the glyph. The space must be assigned to character position 32 otherwise text justification will not work. <p></p> Example for a "simple" encoding that includes the Unicode character space, A, B and ecyrillic: <pre> "# simple 32 0020 0041 0042 0454" </pre><p></p> Example for a "full" encoding for a Type1 Tex font: <pre> "# full 'A' nottriangeqlleft 0041 'B' dividemultiply 0042 32 space 0020" </pre><p></p> This method calls:<br><pre> createFont(name, null, true); </pre></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/font/FontProgramFactory.html#createFont-java.lang.String-
FontProgramFactory createFont	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a new font. This font can be one of the 14 built in types, a Type1 font referred to by an AFM or PFM file, a TrueType font (simple or collection) or a CJK font from the Adobe Asian Font Pack. TrueType fonts and CJK fonts can have an optional style modifier appended to the name. These modifiers are: Bold, Italic and BoldItalic. An example would be "STSong-Light,Bold". Note that this modifiers do not work if the font is embedded. Fonts in TrueType collections are addressed by index such as "msgothic.ttc,1". This would get the second font (indexes start at 0), in this case "MS PGothic". <p></p> The fonts are cached and if they already exist they are extracted from the cache, not parsed again. <p></p> Besides the common encodings described by name, custom encodings can also be made. These encodings will only work for the single byte fonts Type1 and TrueType. The encoding string starts with a '#' followed by "simple" or "full". If "simple" there is a decimal for the first character position and then a list of hex values representing the Unicode codes that compose that encoding.<br> The "simple" encoding is recommended for TrueType fonts as the "full" encoding risks not matching the character with the right glyph if not done with care.<br> The "full" encoding is specially aimed at Type1 fonts where the glyphs have to be described by non standard names like the Tex math fonts. Each group of three elements compose a code position: the one byte code order in decimal or as 'x' (x cannot be the space), the name and the Unicode character used to access the glyph. The space must be assigned to character position 32 otherwise text justification will not work. <p></p> Example for a "simple" encoding that includes the Unicode character space, A, B and ecyrillic: <pre> "# simple 32 0020 0041 0042 0454" </pre><p></p> Example for a "full" encoding for a Type1 Tex font: <pre> "# full 'A' nottriangeqlleft 0041 'B' dividemultiply 0042 32 space 0020" </pre><p></p> This method calls:<br><pre> createFont(name, encoding, embedded, true, null, null); </pre></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/font/FontProgramFactory.html#createFont-java.lang.String-boolean-

FontProgramFactory createFont	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a new font. This font can be one of the 14 built in types, a Type1 font referred to by an AFM or PFM file, a TrueType font (simple or collection) or a CJK font from the Adobe Asian Font Pack. TrueType fonts and CJK fonts can have an optional style modifier appended to the name. These modifiers are: Bold, Italic and BoldItalic. An example would be "STSong-Light,Bold". Note that this modifiers do not work if the font is embedded. Fonts in TrueType collections are addressed by index such as "msgothic.ttc,1". This would get the second font (indexes start at 0), in this case "MS PGothic". <p></p> The fonts may or may not be cached depending on the flag <code>cached</code>. If the <code>byte</code> arrays are present the font will be read from them instead of the name. A name is still required to identify the font type. <p></p> Besides the common encodings described by name, custom encodings can also be made. These encodings will only work for the single byte fonts Type1 and TrueType. The encoding string starts with a '#' followed by "simple" or "full". If "simple" there is a decimal for the first character position and then a list of hex values representing the Unicode codes that compose that encoding.<br> The "simple" encoding is recommended for TrueType fonts as the "full" encoding risks not matching the character with the right glyph if not done with care.<br> The "full" encoding is specially aimed at Type1 fonts where the glyphs have to be described by non standard names like the Tex math fonts. Each group of three elements compose a code position: the one byte code order in decimal or as 'x' (x cannot be the space), the name and the Unicode character used to access the glyph. The space must be assigned to character position 32 otherwise text justification will not work. <p></p> Example for a "simple" encoding that includes the Unicode character space, A, B and ecyrillic: <pre> "# simple 32 0020 0041 0042 0454" </pre><p></p> Example for a "full" encoding for a Type1 Tex font: <pre> "# full 'A' nottriangeqlleft 0041 'B' dividemultiply 0042 32 space 0020" </pre></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/font/FontProgramFactory.html#createFont-java.lang.String-byte:A-boolean-
FontProgramFactory createType1Font	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a new font. FontProgramFactory createFont	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a new True Type font from ttc file, <p></p> The fonts may or may not be cached depending on the flag <code>cached</code>. If the <code>byte</code> arrays are present the font will be read from them instead of the name. A name is still required to identify the font type. <p></p> Besides the common encodings described by name, custom encodings can also be made. These encodings will only work for the single byte fonts Type1 and TrueType. The encoding string starts with a '#' followed by "simple" or "full". If "simple" there is a decimal for the first character position and then a list of hex values representing the Unicode codes that compose that encoding.<br> The "simple" encoding is recommended for TrueType fonts as the "full" encoding risks not matching the character with the right glyph if not done with care.<br> The "full" encoding is specially aimed at Type1 fonts where the glyphs have to be described by non standard names like the Tex math fonts. Each group of three elements compose a code position: the one byte code order in decimal or as 'x' (x cannot be the space), the name and the Unicode character used to access the glyph. The space must be assigned to character position 32 otherwise text justification will not work. <p></p> Example for a "simple" encoding that includes the Unicode character space, A, B and ecyrillic: <pre> "# simple 32 0020 0041 0042 0454" </pre><p></p> Example for a "full" encoding for a Type1 Tex font: <pre> "# full 'A' nottriangeqlleft 0041 'B' dividemultiply 0042 32 space 0020" </pre></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/font/FontProgramFactory.html#createFont-java.lang.String-int-boolean-

HashCode append	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Appends value's hashCode to the current hashCode.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/util/HashCode.html#append-java.lang.Object-
HashCode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This class is a convenience method to sequentially calculate hash code of the object based on the field values. The result depends on the order of elements appended. The exact formula is the same as for java.util.List.hashCode. If you need order independent hash code just summate, multiply or XOR all elements.  Suppose we have class:  class Thing {     long id;     String name;     float weight; }  The hash code calculation can be expressed in 2 forms.  For maximum performance:  public int hashCode() {     int hashCode = HashCode.EMPTY_HASH_CODE;     hashCode = HashCode.combine(hashCode, id);     hashCode = HashCode.combine(hashCode, name);     hashCode = HashCode.combine(hashCode, weight);     return hashCode; }  For convenience:  public int hashCode() {     return new HashCode().append(id).append(name).append(weight).hashCode(); } </p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/util/HashCode.html
HorizontalAlignment values	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, inthe order they are declared. We use zero as terminator, so we'll add 1 to the value.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/hyphenation/HyphenationTree.html#packValues-java.lang.String-

HyphenationTree hstrcmp	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">String compare, returns 0 if equal or t is a substring of s.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/hyphenation/HyphenationTree.html#hstrcmp-char:A-int-char:A-int-
HyphenationTree getValues	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Get values.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/hyphenation/HyphenationTree.html#getValues-int-
HyphenationTree searchPatterns	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><p>Search for all possible partial matches of word starting at index an update interletter values. In other words, it does something like:</p><code> for(i=0; i<patterns.length; (="" )="" <="" code="" i++)="" if="" update_interletter_values(patterns[i]);="" word.substring(index).startswidth(patterns[i])="" {="" }=""><p>But it is done in an efficient way since the patterns are stored in a ternary tree. In fact, this is the whole purpose of having the tree: doing this search without having to test every single pattern. The number of patterns for languages such as English range from 4000 to 10000. Thus, doing thousands of string comparisons for each word to hyphenate would be really slow without the tree. The tradeoff is memory, but using a ternary tree instead of a trie, almost halves the the memory used by Lout or TeX. It's also faster than using a hash table</p></patterns.length;></code></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/hyphenation/HyphenationTree.html#searchPatterns-char:A-int-byte:A-
HyphenationTree hyphenate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Hyphenate word and return a Hyphenation object.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/hyphenation/HyphenationTree.html#hyphenate-java.lang.String-int-int-
HyphenationTree hyphenate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Hyphenate word and return an array of hyphenation points.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/hyphenation/HyphenationTree.html#hyphenate-char:A-int-int-int-int-
HyphenationTree addClass	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Add a character class to the tree. It is used by <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/hyphenation/PatternParser.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.hyphenation"><code>PatternParser</code></a> as callback to add character classes. Character classes define the valid word characters for hyphenation. If a word contains a character not defined in any of the classes, it is not hyphenated. It also defines a way to normalize the characters in order to compare them with the stored patterns. Usually pattern files use only lower case characters, in this case a class for letter 'a', for example, should be defined as "aA", the first character being the normalization char.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/hyphenation/HyphenationTree.html#addClass-java.lang.String-

ImageRenderer layout	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from interface: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/IRenderer.html#layout-com.itextpdf.layout.layout.LayoutContext-">IRenderer</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">This method simulates positioning of the renderer, including all of its children, and returns the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>LayoutResult</code></a>, representing the layout result, including occupied area, status, i.e. if there was enough place to fit the renderer subtree, etc. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>LayoutResult</code></a> can be extended to return custom layout results for custom elements, e.g. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/TextRenderer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.renderer"><code>TextRenderer</code></a> uses <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/TextLayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>TextLayoutResult</code></a> as its result. IRenderer layout	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">This method simulates positioning of the renderer, including all of its children, and returns the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>LayoutResult</code></a>, representing the layout result, including occupied area, status, i.e. if there was enough place to fit the renderer subtree, etc. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>LayoutResult</code></a> can be extended to return custom layout results for custom elements, e.g. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/TextRenderer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.renderer"><code>TextRenderer</code></a> uses <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/TextLayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>TextLayoutResult</code></a> as its result. This method can be called standalone to learn how much area the renderer subtree needs, or can be called before <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/IRenderer.html#draw-com.itextpdf.layout.renderer.DrawContext-"><code>draw(DrawContext)</code></a>, to prepare the renderer to be flushed to the output stream.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/IRenderer.html#layout-com.itextpdf.layout.layout.LayoutContext-

ISO8601Converter parse	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Converts an ISO 8601 string to an <code>XMPDateTime</code>.  Parse a date according to ISO 8601 and http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime: <ul><li>YYYY <li>YYYY-MM <li>YYYY-MM-DD <li>YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmTZD <li>YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD <li>YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD </li></li></li></li></li></li></ul>  Data fields: <ul><li>YYYY = four-digit year <li>MM = two-digit month (01=January, etc.) <li>DD = two-digit day of month (01 through 31) <li>hh = two digits of hour (00 through 23) <li>mm = two digits of minute (00 through 59) <li>ss = two digits of second (00 through 59) <li>s = one or more digits representing a decimal fraction of a second <li>TZD = time zone designator (Z or +hh:mm or -hh:mm) </li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></ul>  Note that ISO 8601 does not seem to allow years less than 1000 or greater than 9999. We allow any year, even negative ones. The year is formatted as "%.4d". <p><em>Note:</em> Tolerate missing TZD, assume is UTC. Photoshop 8 writes dates like this for exif:GPSTimeStamp.<br><em>Note:</em> DOES NOT APPLY ANYMORE. Tolerate missing date portion, in case someone foolishly writes a time-only value that way.</br></p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/impl/ISO8601Converter.html#parse-java.lang.String-
ISO8601Converter render	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Converts a <code>Calendar</code> into an ISO 8601 string. Format a date according to ISO 8601 and http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime: <ul><li>YYYY <li>YYYY-MM <li>YYYY-MM-DD <li>YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmTZD <li>YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD <li>YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD </li></li></li></li></li></li></ul>  Data fields: <ul><li>YYYY = four-digit year <li>MM  = two-digit month (01=January, etc.) <li>DD  = two-digit day of month (01 through 31) <li>hh  = two digits of hour (00 through 23) <li>mm  = two digits of minute (00 through 59) <li>ss  = two digits of second (00 through 59) <li>s   = one or more digits representing a decimal fraction of a second <li>TZD         = time zone designator (Z or +hh:mm or -hh:mm) </li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></ul><p><em>Note:</em> ISO 8601 does not seem to allow years less than 1000 or greater than 9999.  We allow any year, even negative ones. The year is formatted as "%.4d".<p><em>Note:</em> Fix for bug 1269463 (silently fix out of range values) included in parsing. The quasi-bogus "time only" values from Photoshop CS are not supported.</p></p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/impl/ISO8601Converter.html#render-com.itextpdf.kernel.xmp.XMPDateTime-
ISO8601Converter	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Converts between ISO 8601 Strings and Calendar with millisecond resolution.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/impl/ISO8601Converter.html

Latin1Converter convert	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">A converter that processes a byte buffer containing a mix of UTF8 and Latin-1/Cp1252 chars. The result is a buffer where those chars have been converted to UTF-8;  that means it contains only valid UTF-8 chars. <p><em>Explanation of the processing:</em> First the encoding of the buffer is detected looking  at the first four bytes (that works only if the buffer starts with an ASCII-char,  like xmls &amp;apos;&lt;&amp;apos;). UTF-16/32 flavours do not require further proccessing. <p>  In the case, UTF-8 is detected, it assumes wrong UTF8 chars to be a sequence of  Latin-1/Cp1252 encoded bytes and converts the chars to their corresponding UTF-8 byte  sequence. <p>  The 0x80..0x9F range is undefined in Latin-1, but is defined in Windows code page 1252. The bytes 0x81, 0x8D, 0x8F, 0x90, and 0x9D are formally undefined by Windows 1252. These are in XML's RestrictedChar set, so we map them to a space.  <p> The official Latin-1 characters in the range 0xA0..0xFF are converted into the Unicode Latin Supplement range U+00A0 - U+00FF. <p><em>Example:</em> If an Euro-symbol (â¬) appears in the byte buffer (0xE2, 0x82, 0xAC),  it will be left as is. But if only the first two bytes are appearing,  followed by an ASCII char a (0xE2 - 0x82 - 0x41), it will be converted to  0xC3, 0xA2 (Ã¢) - 0xE2, 0x80, 0x9A (â) - 0x41 (a).</p></p></p></p></p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/impl/Latin1Converter.html#convert-com.itextpdf.kernel.xmp.impl.ByteBuffer-
Latin1Converter	A										<section class="prog__container"><p></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/impl/Latin1Converter.html

Leading	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A specialized class that specifies the leading, "the vertical distance between the baselines of adjacent lines of text" (ISO-32000-1, section 9.3.5). LocationTextExtractionStrategy isChunkAtWordBoundary	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Determines if a space character should be inserted between a previous chunk and the current chunk. This method is exposed as a callback so subclasses can fine time the algorithm for determining whether a space should be inserted or not. By default, this method will insert a space if the there is a gap of more than half the font space character width between the end of the previous chunk and the beginning of the current chunk.  It will also indicate that a space is needed if the starting point of the new chunk appears *before* the end of the previous chunk (i.e. overlapping text).</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/parser/listener/LocationTextExtractionStrategy.html#isChunkAtWordBoundary-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.parser.listener.LocationTextExtractionStrategy.TextChunk-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.parser.listener.LocationTextExtractionStrategy.TextChunk-

OutputStream	A										<section class="prog__container"><p></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/OutputStream.html
OutputStreamAesEncryption write	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Writes <code>len</code> bytes from the specified byte array starting at offset <code>off</code> to this output stream. The general contract for <code>write(b, off, len)</code> is that some of the bytes in the array <code>b</code> are written to the output stream in order; element <code>b[off]</code> is the first byte written and <code>b[off+len-1]</code> is the last byte written by this operation. <p></p> The <code>write</code> method of <code>OutputStream</code> calls the write method of one argument on each of the bytes to be written out. Subclasses are encouraged to override this method and provide a more efficient implementation. <p></p> If <code>b</code> is <code>null</code>, a <code>NullPointerException</code> is thrown. <p></p> If <code>off</code> is negative, or <code>len</code> is negative, or <code>off+len</code> is greater than the length of the array <code>b</code>, then an <tt>IndexOutOfBoundsException</tt> is thrown.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/crypto/OutputStreamAesEncryption.html#write-byte:A-int-int-
OutputStreamAesEncryption	A										<section class="prog__container"><p></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/crypto/OutputStreamAesEncryption.html
OutputStreamEncryption close	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Closes this output stream and releases any system resources associated with this stream. The general contract of <code>close</code> is that it closes the output stream. A closed stream cannot perform output operations and cannot be reopened. <p></p> The <code>close</code> method of <code>OutputStream</code> does nothing.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/crypto/OutputStreamEncryption.html#close--
OutputStreamEncryption flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Flushes this output stream and forces any buffered output bytes to be written out. The general contract of <code>flush</code> is that calling it is an indication that, if any bytes previously written have been buffered by the implementation of the output stream, such bytes should immediately be written to their intended destination. <p></p> The <code>flush</code> method of <code>OutputStream</code> does nothing.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/crypto/OutputStreamEncryption.html#flush--
OutputStreamEncryption write	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Writes <code>b.length</code> bytes from the specified byte array to this output stream. The general contract for <code>write(b)</code> is that it should have exactly the same effect as the call <code>write(b, 0, b.length)</code>.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/crypto/OutputStreamEncryption.html#write-byte:A-
OutputStreamEncryption write	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Writes the specified byte to this output stream. The general contract for <code>write</code> is that one byte is written to the output stream. The byte to be written is the eight low-order bits of the argument <code>b</code>. The 24 high-order bits of <code>b</code> are ignored. <p></p> Subclasses of <code>OutputStream</code> must provide an implementation for this method.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/crypto/OutputStreamEncryption.html#write-int-
OutputStreamEncryption write	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Writes <code>len</code> bytes from the specified byte array starting at offset <code>off</code> to this output stream. The general contract for <code>write(b, off, len)</code> is that some of the bytes in the array <code>b</code> are written to the output stream in order; element <code>b[off]</code> is the first byte written and <code>b[off+len-1]</code> is the last byte written by this operation. <p></p> The <code>write</code> method of <code>OutputStream</code> calls the write method of one argument on each of the bytes to be written out. Subclasses are encouraged to override this method and provide a more efficient implementation. <p></p> If <code>b</code> is <code>null</code>, a <code>NullPointerException</code> is thrown. <p></p> If <code>off</code> is negative, or <code>len</code> is negative, or <code>off+len</code> is greater than the length of the array <code>b</code>, then an <tt>IndexOutOfBoundsException</tt> is thrown.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/crypto/OutputStreamEncryption.html#write-byte:A-int-int-

The general contract for <code>write(b, off, len)</code> is that some of the bytes in the array <code>b</code> are written to the output stream in order; element <code>b[off]</code> is the first byte written and <code>b[off+len-1]</code> is the last byte written by this operation. <p></p> The <code>write</code> method of <code>OutputStream</code> calls the write method of one argument on each of the bytes to be written out. PdfAChecker checkFont	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Performs a number of checks on the font. See ISO 19005-1 section 6.3, ISO 19005-2 and ISO 19005-3 section 6.2.11. Be aware that not all constraints defined in the ISO are checked in this method, for most of them we consider that iText always creates valid fonts.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/pdfa/checker/PdfAChecker.html#checkFont-com.itextpdf.kernel.font.PdfFont-
PdfAChecker	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An abstract class that will run through all necessary checks defined in the different PDF/A standards and levels. A number of common checks are executed in this class, while standard-dependent specifications are implemented in the available subclasses. The standard that is followed is the series of ISO 19005 specifications, currently generations 1 through 3. The ZUGFeRD standard is derived from ISO 19005-3.  While it is possible to subclass this method and implement its abstract methods in client code, this is not encouraged and will have little effect. It is not possible to plug custom implementations into iText, because iText should always refuse to create non-compliant PDF/A, which would be possible with client code implementations. Any future generations of the PDF/A standard and its derivates will get their own implementation in the iText 7 - pdfa project.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/pdfa/checker/PdfAChecker.html
PdfAConformanceException	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Exception that is thrown when the PDF Document doesn't adhere to the PDF/A specification.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/pdfa/PdfAConformanceException.html
PdfAConformanceLevel	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Enumeration of all the PDF/A conformance levels.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfAConformanceLevel.html

Don't use it unless your environment is well controlled. The default is <code>true</code>. <p> If generateAppearance is set to <code>true</code>, then <code>NeedAppearances</code> is set to <code>false</code>. This does not apply vice versa.</p></p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/forms/PdfAcroForm.html#setGenerateAppearance-boolean-

PdfAcroForm isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/forms/PdfAcroForm.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfAction flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#makeIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code></a>. For example: wrapperInstance.makeIndirect(document).flush(); Note that not every wrapper require this, only those that have such warning in documentation.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/action/PdfAction.html#flush--
PdfAction isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/action/PdfAction.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfADocument	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This class extends PdfDocument and is in charge of creating files that comply with the PDF/A standard.  Client code is still responsible for making sure the file is actually PDF/A compliant: multiple steps must be undertaken (depending on the PdfAConformanceLevel) to ensure that the PDF/A standard is followed.  This class will throw exceptions, mostly PdfAConformanceException,  and thus refuse to output a PDF/A file if at any point the document does not adhere to the PDF/A guidelines specified by the PdfAConformanceLevel.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/pdfa/PdfADocument.html

PdfAnnotation getFlags	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">A set of flags specifying various characteristics of the annotation (see ISO-320001 12.5.3, âAnnotation Flagsâ). For specific annotation flag constants see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#setFlag-int-"><code>setFlag(int)</code></a>. Default value: 0.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#getFlags--
PdfAnnotation setFlags	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets a set of flags specifying various characteristics of the annotation (see ISO-320001 12.5.3, âAnnotation Flagsâ). On the contrary from <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#setFlag-int-"><code>setFlag(int)</code></a>, this method sets a complete set of enabled and disabled flags at once. If not set specifically the default value is 0.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#setFlags-int-
PdfAnnotation setFlag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets a flag that specifies a characteristic of the annotation to enabled state (see ISO-320001 12.5.3, âAnnotation Flagsâ). On the contrary from <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#setFlags-int-"><code>setFlags(int)</code></a>, this method sets only specified flags to enabled state, but doesn't disable other flags. Possible flags: <ul><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#INVISIBLE"><code>INVISIBLE</code></a> - If set, do not display the annotation if it does not belong to one of the     standard annotation types and no annotation handler is available. If clear, display such unknown annotation     using an appearance stream specified by its appearance dictionary, if any.     </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#HIDDEN"><code>HIDDEN</code></a> - If set, do not display or print the annotation or allow it to interact with     the user, regardless of its annotation type or whether an annotation handler is available.     </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#PRINT"><code>PRINT</code></a> - If set, print the annotation when the page is printed. If clear, never print     the annotation, regardless of whether it is displayed on the screen.     </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#NO_ZOOM"><code>NO_ZOOM</code></a> - If set, do not scale the annotationâs appearance to match the magnification of     the page. The location of the annotation on the page (defined by the upper-left corner of its annotation     rectangle) shall remain fixed, regardless of the page magnification.}     </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#NO_ROTATE"><code>NO_ROTATE</code></a> - If set, do not rotate the annotationâs appearance to match the rotation     of the page. The upper-left corner of the annotation rectangle shall remain in a fixed location on the page,     regardless of the page rotation.     </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#NO_VIEW"><code>NO_VIEW</code></a> - If set, do not display the annotation on the screen or allow it to interact     with the user. The annotation may be printed (depending on the setting of the Print flag) but should be considered     hidden for purposes of on-screen display and user interaction.     </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#READ_ONLY"><code>READ_ONLY</code></a> -  If set, do not allow the annotation to interact with the user. The annotation     may be displayed or printed (depending on the settings of the NoView and Print flags) but should not respond to mouse     clicks or change its appearance in response to mouse motions.     </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#LOCKED"><code>LOCKED</code></a> -  If set, do not allow the annotation to be deleted or its properties     (including position and size) to be modified by the user. However, this flag does not restrict changes to     the annotationâs contents, such as the value of a form field.     </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#TOGGLE_NO_VIEW"><code>TOGGLE_NO_VIEW</code></a> - If set, invert the interpretation of the NoView flag for certain events.     </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#LOCKED_CONTENTS"><code>LOCKED_CONTENTS</code></a> - If set, do not allow the contents of the annotation to be modified     by the user. This flag does not restrict deletion of the annotation or changes to other annotation properties,     such as position and size.     </li></ul></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#setFlag-int-

PdfAnnotation getBorder	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><p> An array specifying the characteristics of the annotationâs border. The array consists of three numbers defining the horizontal corner radius, vertical corner radius, and border width, all in default user space units. If the corner radii are 0, the border has square (not rounded) corners; if the border width is 0, no border is drawn. <p> The array may have a fourth element, an optional dash array (see ISO-320001 8.4.3.6, âLine Dash Patternâ).</p></p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#getBorder--

PdfAnnotation setStructParentIndex	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets he integer key of the annotationâs entry in the structural parent tree (see ISO-320001 14.7.4.4, âFinding Structure Elements from Content Itemsâ). Note: Normally, there is no need to take care of this manually, struct parent index is set automatically if annotation is added to the tagged document's page.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#setStructParentIndex-int-
PdfAnnotation getOpen	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">A flag specifying whether the annotation shall initially be displayed open. PdfAnnotation setOpen	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets a flag specifying whether the annotation shall initially be displayed open. This flag has affect to not all kinds of annotations.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#setOpen-boolean-
PdfAnnotation getQuadPoints	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">An array of 8 Ã n numbers specifying the coordinates of n quadrilaterals in default user space. Quadrilaterals are used to define: <ul><li>regions inside annotation rectangle in which the link annotation should be activated;</li><li>a word or group of contiguous words in the text underlying the text markup annotation;</li><li>the content region that is intended to be removed for a redaction annotation;</li></ul><p> IMPORTANT NOTE: According to Table 179 in ISO 32000-1, the QuadPoints array lists the vertices in counterclockwise order and the text orientation is defined by the first and second vertex. This basically means QuadPoints is specified as lower-left, lower-right, top-right, top-left. HOWEVER, Adobe's interpretation (tested at least with Acrobat 10, Acrobat 11, Reader 11) is top-left, top-right, lower-left, lower-right (Z-shaped order). This means that if the QuadPoints array is specified according to the standard, the rendering is not as expected. Other viewers seem to follow Adobe's interpretation. Hence we recommend to use and expect QuadPoints array in Z-order, just as Acrobat and probably most other viewers expect.</p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#getQuadPoints--
PdfAnnotation setQuadPoints	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets n quadrilaterals in default user space by passing an <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfArray.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf"><code>PdfArray</code></a> of 8 Ã n numbers. For more info of what quadrilaterals define see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#getQuadPoints--"><code>getQuadPoints()</code></a>. <p> IMPORTANT NOTE: According to Table 179 in ISO 32000-1, the QuadPoints array lists the vertices in counterclockwise order and the text orientation is defined by the first and second vertex. This basically means QuadPoints is specified as lower-left, lower-right, top-right, top-left. HOWEVER, Adobe's interpretation (tested at least with Acrobat 10, Acrobat 11, Reader 11) is top-left, top-right, lower-left, lower-right (Z-shaped order). This means that if the QuadPoints array is specified according to the standard, the rendering is not as expected. Other viewers seem to follow Adobe's interpretation. Hence we recommend to use and expect QuadPoints array in Z-order, just as Acrobat and probably most other viewers expect.</p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#setQuadPoints-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfArray-
PdfAnnotation setBorderStyle	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets border style dictionary that has more settings than the array specified for the Border entry (<a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#getBorder--"><code>getBorder()</code></a>). See ISO-320001, Table 166 and <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#getBorderStyle--"><code>getBorderStyle()</code></a> for more info.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#setBorderStyle-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDictionary-
PdfAnnotation setBorderStyle	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Setter for the annotation's preset border style. Possible values are <ul><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#STYLE_SOLID"><code>STYLE_SOLID</code></a> - A solid rectangle surrounding the annotation.</li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#STYLE_DASHED"><code>STYLE_DASHED</code></a> - A dashed rectangle surrounding the annotation.</li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#STYLE_BEVELED"><code>STYLE_BEVELED</code></a> - A simulated embossed rectangle that appears to be raised above the surface of the page.</li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#STYLE_INSET"><code>STYLE_INSET</code></a> - A simulated engraved rectangle that appears to be recessed below the surface of the page.</li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#STYLE_UNDERLINE"><code>STYLE_UNDERLINE</code></a> - A single line along the bottom of the annotation rectangle.</li></ul> See also ISO-320001, Table 166.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#setBorderStyle-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfName-

PdfAnnotation getBorderStyle	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">The dictionaries for some annotation types (such as free text and polygon annotations) can include the BS entry. That entry specifies a border style dictionary that has more settings than the array specified for the Border entry (see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#getBorder--"><code>getBorder()</code></a>). If an annotation dictionary includes the BS entry, then the Border entry is ignored. If annotation includes AP (see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#getAppearanceDictionary--"><code>getAppearanceDictionary()</code></a>) it takes precedence over the BS entry. PdfAnnotation flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. PdfAnnotation isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfCanvas	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>PdfCanvas class represents an algorithm for writing data into content stream. PdfCanvasConstants.LineCapStyle	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The line cap style specifies the shape to be used at the ends of open subpaths (and dashes, if any) when they are stroked.  All documentation for this class is taken from ISO 32000-1, section 8.4.3.3 "Line Cap Style".</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/PdfCanvasConstants.LineCapStyle.html
PdfCanvasConstants.LineJoinStyle	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The line join style specifies the shape to be used at the corners of paths that are stroked. Join styles are significant only at points where consecutive segments of a path connect at an angle; segments that meet or intersect fortuitously receive no special treatment.  All documentation for this class is taken from ISO 32000-1, section 8.4.3.4 "Line Join Style".</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/PdfCanvasConstants.LineJoinStyle.html
PdfCanvasConstants.TextRenderingMode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The text rendering mode determines whether showing text causes glyph outlines to be stroked, filled, used as a clipping boundary, or some combination of the three. Stroking, filling, and clipping have the same effects for a text object as they do for a path object, although they are specified in an entirely different way.  If the text rendering mode calls for filling, the current nonstroking color in the graphics state is used; if it calls for stroking, the current stroking color is used.  All documentation for this class is taken from ISO 32000-1, section 9.3.6 "Text Rendering Mode".</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/PdfCanvasConstants.TextRenderingMode.html
PdfCanvasParser parse	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Parses a single command from the content. Each command is output as an array of arguments having the command itself as the last element. The returned array will be empty if the end of content was reached. <br> A specific behaviour occurs when inline image is encountered (BI command): in that case, parser would continue parsing until it meets EI - end of the inline image; as a result in this case it will return an array with inline image dictionary and image bytes encapsulated in PdfStream object as first element and EI command as second element.</br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/parser/util/PdfCanvasParser.html#parse-java.util.List-
