PdfCatalog getOCProperties	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Use this method to get the <b>Optional Content Properties Dictionary</b>. Note that if you call this method, then the PdfDictionary with OCProperties will be generated from PdfOCProperties object right before closing the PdfDocument, so if you want to make low-level changes in Pdf structures themselves (PdfArray, PdfDictionary, etc), then you should address directly those objects, e.g.: <code> PdfCatalog pdfCatalog = pdfDoc.getCatalog(); PdfDictionary ocProps = pdfCatalog.getAsDictionary(PdfName.OCProperties); // manipulate with ocProps. </code> Also note that this method is implicitly called when creating a new PdfLayer instance, so you should either use hi-level logic of operating with layers, or manipulate low-level Pdf objects by yourself.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfCatalog.html#getOCProperties-boolean-

PdfCieBasedCs flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#makeIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code></a>. For example: wrapperInstance.makeIndirect(document).flush(); Note that not every wrapper require this, only those that have such warning in documentation.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfCieBasedCs.html#flush--
PdfCieBasedCs isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfCieBasedCs.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfDate isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfDate.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--
PdfDate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>PdfDate is the PDF date object.  PDF defines a standard date format. The PDF date format closely follows the format defined by the international standard ASN.1 (Abstract Syntax Notation One, defined in CCITT X.208 or ISO/IEC 8824). A date is a PdfString of the form:  (D:YYYYMMDDHHmmSSOHH'mm')  This object is described in the 'Portable Document Format Reference Manual version 1.3' section 7.2 (page 183-184)</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfDate.html

PdfDeveloperExtension getDeveloperExtensions	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Generations the developer extension dictionary corresponding with the prefix.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfDeveloperExtension.html#getDeveloperExtensions--
PdfDeveloperExtension	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Beginning with BaseVersion 1.7, the extensions dictionary lets developers designate that a given document contains extensions to PDF. The presence of the extension dictionary in a document indicates that it may contain developer-specific PDF properties that extend a particular base version of the PDF specification. The extensions dictionary enables developers to identify their own extensions relative to a base version of PDF. Additionally, the convention identifies extension levels relative to that base version. The intent of this dictionary is to enable developers of PDF-producing applications to identify company-specific specifications (such as this one) that PDF-consuming applications use to interpret the extensions.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfDeveloperExtension.html

PdfDictionary	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A representation of a Dictionary as described by the PDF Specification. A Dictionary is a mapping between keys and values. Keys are PdfNames and the values are PdfObjects. Each key can only be associated with one value and adding a new value to an existing key will override the previous value. A value of null should be ignored when the PdfDocument is closed.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfDictionary.html

PdfDocumentInfo isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfDocumentInfo.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfEncryption flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#makeIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code></a>. For example: wrapperInstance.makeIndirect(document).flush(); Note that not every wrapper require this, only those that have such warning in documentation.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfEncryption.html#flush--

PdfExtGState flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#makeIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code></a>. For example: wrapperInstance.makeIndirect(document).flush(); Note that not every wrapper require this, only those that have such warning in documentation.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/extgstate/PdfExtGState.html#flush--
PdfExtGState isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/extgstate/PdfExtGState.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfFont setSubset	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Indicates if all the glyphs and widths for that particular encoding should be included in the document. When set to <code>true</code> only the glyphs used will be included in the font. When set to <code>false</code> and <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/font/PdfFont.html#addSubsetRange-int:A-"><code>addSubsetRange(int[])</code></a> was not called the full font will be included otherwise just the characters ranges will be included.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/font/PdfFont.html#setSubset-boolean-

PdfFormField isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/forms/fields/PdfFormField.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#makeIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code></a>. PdfFunction isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/function/PdfFunction.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfImageXObject identifyImageType	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Identifies the type of the image that is stored in the bytes of this <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/xobject/PdfImageXObject.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.xobject"><code>PdfImageXObject</code></a>. Note that this has nothing to do with the original type of the image. For instance, the return value of this method will never be <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/image/ImageType.html#PNG"><code>ImageType.PNG</code></a> as we loose this information when converting a PNG image into something that can be put into a PDF file. The possible values are: <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/image/ImageType.html#JPEG"><code>ImageType.JPEG</code></a>, <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/image/ImageType.html#JPEG2000"><code>ImageType.JPEG2000</code></a>, <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/image/ImageType.html#JBIG2"><code>ImageType.JBIG2</code></a>, <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/image/ImageType.html#TIFF"><code>ImageType.TIFF</code></a>, <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/image/ImageType.html#PNG"><code>ImageType.PNG</code></a></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/xobject/PdfImageXObject.html#identifyImageType--
PdfImageXObject identifyImageFileExtension	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Identifies recommended file extension to store the bytes of this <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/xobject/PdfImageXObject.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.xobject"><code>PdfImageXObject</code></a>. Possible values are: 'png', 'jpg', 'jp2', 'tif', 'jbig2'. This extension can later be used together with the result of <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/xobject/PdfImageXObject.html#getImageBytes--"><code>getImageBytes()</code></a>.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/xobject/PdfImageXObject.html#identifyImageFileExtension--

PdfLayerMembership setVisibilityPolicy	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the visibility policy for content belonging to this membership dictionary. Possible values are AllOn, AnyOn, AnyOff and AllOff. AllOn - Visible only if all of the entries are <b>ON</b>. AnyOn - Visible if any of the entries are <b>ON</b>. AnyOff - Visible if any of the entries are <b>OFF</b>. AllOff - Visible only if all of the entries are <b>OFF</b>. The default value is AnyOn.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/layer/PdfLayerMembership.html#setVisibilityPolicy-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfName-

PdfLayerMembership	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Content typically belongs to a single optional content group, and is visible when the group is ON and invisible when it is OFF. To express more complex visibility policies, content should not declare itself to belong to an optional content group directly, but rather to an optional content membership dictionary represented by this class.  To be able to be wrapped with this PdfObjectWrapper the PdfObject must be indirect.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/layer/PdfLayerMembership.html
PdfLineAnnotation getSubtype	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Gets a <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf"><code>PdfName</code></a> which value is a subtype of this annotation. PdfLineAnnotation getLine	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">An array of four numbers, [x1 y1 x2 y2], specifying the starting and ending coordinates of the line in default user space. If the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#LL"><code>PdfName.LL</code></a> (see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLeaderLine--"><code>getLeaderLine()</code></a>) entry is present, this value represents the endpoints of the leader lines rather than the endpoints of the line itself.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLine--
PdfLineAnnotation getLineEndingStyles	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">An array of two names specifying the line ending styles that is used in drawing the line. The first and second elements of the array shall specify the line ending styles for the endpoints defined, respectively, by the first and second pairs of coordinates, (x1, y1) and (x2, y2), in the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#L"><code>PdfName.L</code></a> array (see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLine--"><code>getLine()</code></a>. For possible values see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#setLineEndingStyles-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfArray-"><code>setLineEndingStyles(PdfArray)</code></a>.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLineEndingStyles--
PdfLineAnnotation setLineEndingStyles	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the line ending styles that are used in drawing the line. The first and second elements of the array shall specify the line ending styles for the endpoints defined, respectively, by the first and second pairs of coordinates, (x1, y1) and (x2, y2), in the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#L"><code>PdfName.L</code></a> array (see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLine--"><code>getLine()</code></a>. Possible values for styles are: <ul><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Square"><code>PdfName.Square</code></a> - A square filled with the annotation's interior color, if any; </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Circle"><code>PdfName.Circle</code></a> - A circle filled with the annotation's interior color, if any; </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Diamond"><code>PdfName.Diamond</code></a> - A diamond shape filled with the annotation's interior color, if any; </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#OpenArrow"><code>PdfName.OpenArrow</code></a> - Two short lines meeting in an acute angle to form an open arrowhead; </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#ClosedArrow"><code>PdfName.ClosedArrow</code></a> - Two short lines meeting in an acute angle as in the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#OpenArrow"><code>PdfName.OpenArrow</code></a> style and     connected by a third line to form a triangular closed arrowhead filled with the annotation's interior color, if any; </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#None"><code>PdfName.None</code></a> - No line ending; </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Butt"><code>PdfName.Butt</code></a> - A short line at the endpoint perpendicular to the line itself; </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#ROpenArrow"><code>PdfName.ROpenArrow</code></a> - Two short lines in the reverse direction from <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#OpenArrow"><code>PdfName.OpenArrow</code></a>; </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#RClosedArrow"><code>PdfName.RClosedArrow</code></a> - A triangular closed arrowhead in the reverse direction from <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#ClosedArrow"><code>PdfName.ClosedArrow</code></a>; </li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Slash"><code>PdfName.Slash</code></a> - A short line at the endpoint approximately 30 degrees clockwise from perpendicular to the line itself; </li></ul> see also ISO-320001, Table 176 "Line ending styles".</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#setLineEndingStyles-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfArray-
PdfLineAnnotation getLeaderLine	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><span class="deprecatedLabel">Deprecated.</span> <span class="deprecationComment">use <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLeaderLineLength--"><code>getLeaderLineLength()</code></a> instead.</span></div><br><div class="block">The length of leader lines in default user space that extend from each endpoint of the line perpendicular to the line itself. A positive value means that the leader lines appear in the direction that is clockwise when traversing the line from its starting point to its ending point (as specified by <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#L"><code>PdfName.L</code></a> (see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLine--"><code>getLine()</code></a>); a negative value indicates the opposite direction.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLeaderLine--

PdfLineAnnotation getCaptionOffset	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">An array of two numbers that specifies the offset of the caption text from its normal position. The first value is the horizontal offset along the annotation line from its midpoint, with a positive value indicating offset to the right and a negative value indicating offset to the left. The second value is the vertical offset perpendicular to the annotation line, with a positive value indicating a shift up and a negative value indicating a shift down.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getCaptionOffset--

PdfMarkupAnnotation getReplyType	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">A name specifying the relationship (the âreply typeâ) between this annotation and one specified by IRT entry (see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html#getInReplyTo--"><code>getInReplyTo()</code></a>). Valid values are: <ul><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#R"><code>PdfName.R</code></a> - The annotation shall be considered a reply to the annotation specified by IRT.     Conforming readers shall not display replies to an annotation individually but together in the form of     threaded comments.</li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Group"><code>PdfName.Group</code></a> - The annotation shall be grouped with the annotation specified by IRT.</li></ul></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html#getReplyType--

PdfMarkupAnnotation setIntent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets a name describing the intent of the markup annotation. Intents allow conforming readers to distinguish between different uses and behaviors of a single markup annotation type. If this entry is not present or its value is the same as the annotation type, the annotation shall have no explicit intent and should behave in a generic manner in a conforming reader. <p> See ISO-320001, free text annotations (Table 174), line annotations (Table 175), polygon annotations (Table 178), and polyline annotations (Table 178) for the specific intent values for those types. </p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html#setIntent-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfName-
PdfMarkupAnnotation getExternalData	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">An external data dictionary specifying data that shall be associated with the annotation. This dictionary contains the following entries: <ul><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Type"><code>PdfName.Type</code></a> - (optional) If present, shall be <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#ExData"><code>PdfName.ExData</code></a>.</li><li><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Subtype"><code>PdfName.Subtype</code></a> - (required) a name specifying the type of data that the markup annotation     shall be associated with. The only defined value is <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Markup3D"><code>PdfName.Markup3D</code></a>. Table 298 (ISO-320001)     lists the values that correspond to a subtype of Markup3D (See also <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/Pdf3DAnnotation.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.annot"><code>Pdf3DAnnotation</code></a>).</li></ul></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html#getExternalData--

PdfMarkupAnnotation setRectangleDifferences	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">A set of four numbers describing the numerical differences between two rectangles: the Rect entry of the annotation and another rectangle within that one, which meaning depends on the type of the annotation: <ul><li> for <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfFreeTextAnnotation.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.annot"><code>PdfFreeTextAnnotation</code></a> the inner rectangle is where the annotation's text should be displayed;</li><li>         for <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfSquareAnnotation.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.annot"><code>PdfSquareAnnotation</code></a> and <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfCircleAnnotation.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.annot"><code>PdfCircleAnnotation</code></a> the inner rectangle is the actual boundaries         of the underlying square or circle;     </li><li> for <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfCaretAnnotation.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.annot"><code>PdfCaretAnnotation</code></a> the inner rectangle is the actual boundaries of the underlying caret.</li></ul></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html#setRectangleDifferences-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfArray-

PdfMarkupAnnotation	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This is a super class for the annotations which are defined as markup annotations because they are used primarily to mark up PDF documents. These annotations have text that appears as part of the annotation and may be displayed in other ways by a conforming reader, such as in a Comments pane. See also ISO-320001 12.5.6.2 "Markup Annotations".</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html
PdfMcr isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagging/PdfMcr.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfMediaClipData flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#makeIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code></a>. For example: wrapperInstance.makeIndirect(document).flush(); Note that not every wrapper require this, only those that have such warning in documentation.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/action/PdfMediaClipData.html#flush--
PdfMediaClipData isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/action/PdfMediaClipData.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfMerger close	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Closes the current document. PdfObjectWrapper isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--
PdfObjectWrapper ensureObjectIsAddedToDocument	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Some wrappers use object's indirect reference to obtain the <code>PdfDocument</code> to which the object belongs to. For this matter, for these wrappers it is implicitly defined that they work with indirect objects only. Commonly these wrappers have two constructors: one with <code>PdfDocument</code> as parameter to create a new object, and the other one which wraps around the given <code>PdfObject</code>. This method should be used in the second type of constructors to ensure that wrapper will able to obtain the <code>PdfDocument</code> instance.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#markObjectAsIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfObject-

That is, the state of at most one optional content group in the array should be ON at a time: if one group is turned ON, all others must be turned OFF.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/layer/PdfOCProperties.html#addOCGRadioGroup-java.util.List-

PdfOutputIntent isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfOutputIntent.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfPage getResources	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Gets the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfResources.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf"><code>PdfResources</code></a> wrapper object for this page resources. If page doesn't have resource object, then it will be inherited from page's parents. If neither parents nor page has the resource object, then the new one is created and added to page dictionary. <br/><br/> NOTE: If you'll try to modify the inherited resources, then the new resources object will be created, so you won't change the parent's resources. This new object under the wrapper will be added to page dictionary on <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfPage.html#flush--"><code>flush()</code></a>, or you can add it manually with this line, if needed:<br/><code>getPdfObject().put(PdfName.Resources, getResources().getPdfObject());</code></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfPage.html#getResources--

PdfPage flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Flushes page and it's content stream. <br><br> If the page belongs to the document which is tagged, page flushing also triggers flushing of the tags, which are considered to belong to the page. The logic that defines if the given tag (structure element) belongs to the page is the following: if all the marked content references (dictionary or number references), that are the descenders of the given structure element, belong to the current page - the tag is considered to belong to the page. If tag has descenders from several pages - it is flushed, if all other pages except the current one are flushed.</br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfPage.html#flush--
PdfPage flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Flushes page and its content stream. If <code>flushContentStreams</code> is true, all content streams that are rendered on this page (like FormXObjects, annotation appearance streams, patterns) and also all images associated with this page will also be flushed. <br> For notes about tag structure flushing see <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfPage.html#flush--"><code>PdfPage#flush() method</code></a>. <br><br> If <code>PdfADocument</code> is used, flushing will be applied only if <code>flushContentStreams</code> is true.</br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfPage.html#flush-boolean-

PdfPage isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfPage.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfPKCS7 getAuthenticatedAttributeBytes	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">When using authenticatedAttributes the authentication process is different. The document digest is generated and put inside the attribute. The signing is done over the DER encoded authenticatedAttributes. This method provides that encoding and the parameters must be exactly the same as in <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfPKCS7.html#getEncodedPKCS7-byte:A-"><code>getEncodedPKCS7(byte[])</code></a>. <p> A simple example: <p><pre> Calendar cal = Calendar.getInstance(); PdfPKCS7 pk7 = new PdfPKCS7(key, chain, null, "SHA1", null, false); MessageDigest messageDigest = MessageDigest.getInstance("SHA1"); byte[] buf = new byte[8192]; int n; InputStream inp = sap.getRangeStream(); while ((n = inp.read(buf)) &gt; 0) {    messageDigest.update(buf, 0, n); } byte[] hash = messageDigest.digest(); byte[] sh = pk7.getAuthenticatedAttributeBytes(hash, cal); pk7.update(sh, 0, sh.length); byte[] sg = pk7.getEncodedPKCS7(hash, cal); </pre></p></p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfPKCS7.html#getAuthenticatedAttributeBytes-byte:A-byte:A-java.util.Collection-com.itextpdf.signatures.PdfSigner.CryptoStandard-

Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#makeIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code></a>. PdfShading.CoonsPatchMesh	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The class that extends PdfShading class and is in charge of Shading Dictionary with Coons Patch mesh type. This type of shading is constructed from one or more colour patches, each bounded by four cubic BÃ©zier curves. Degenerate BÃ©zier curves are allowed and are useful for certain graphical effects. At least one complete patch shall be specified. The shape of patch is defined by 12 control points. Colours are specified for each corner of the unit square, and bilinear interpolation is used to fill in colours over the entire unit square. Coordinates are mapped from the unit square into a four-sided patch whose sides are not necessarily linear. The mapping is continuous: the corners of the unit square map to corners of the patch and the sides of the unit square map to sides of the patch. For the format of data stream, that defines patches Table 85. If the shading dictionary contains a Function entry, the colour data for each corner of a patch shall be specified by a single parametric value t rather than by n separate colour components c1â¦cn.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfShading.CoonsPatchMesh.html

PdfShading.FreeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The class that extends PdfShading class and is in charge of Shading Dictionary with free-form Gouraud-shaded triangle mesh type. The area to be shaded is defined by a path composed entirely of triangles. The colour at each vertex of the triangles is specified, and a technique known as Gouraud interpolation is used to colour the interiors. The object shall be represented as stream containing a sequence of vertex data. Each vertex is specified by the following values, in the order shown: f x y c1 â¦ cn where: f -  the vertexâs edge flag, that determines the vertex is connected to other vertices of the triangle mesh.      For full description Paragph 8.7.4.5.5 x, y - vertexâs horizontal and vertical coordinates, expressed in the shadingâs target coordinate space. c1â¦cn - vertexâs colour components. If the shading dictionary includes a Function entry, only a single parametric value, t, shall be specified for each vertex in place of the colour components c1â¦cn.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfShading.FreeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh.html

PdfShading flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#makeIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code></a>. For example: wrapperInstance.makeIndirect(document).flush(); Note that not every wrapper require this, only those that have such warning in documentation.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfShading.html#flush--
PdfShading isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfShading.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfShading.LatticeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The class that extends PdfShading class and is in charge of Shading Dictionary with lattice-form Gouraud-shaded triangle mesh type. This type is similar to PdfShading.FreeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh but instead of using free-form geometry, the vertices are arranged in a pseudorectangular lattice, which is topologically equivalent to a rectangular grid. The vertices are organized into rows, which need not be geometrically linear. The verticals data in stream is similar to PdfShading.FreeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh, except there is no edge flag.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfShading.LatticeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh.html

The radii r0 and r1 shall both be greater than or equal to 0. If one radius is 0, the corresponding circle shall be treated as a point; if both are 0, nothing shall be painted.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfShading.Radial.html#getCoords--

PdfShading.TensorProductPatchMesh	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The class that extends PdfShading class and is in charge of Shading Dictionary with Tensor-Product Patch mesh type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/forms/PdfSigFieldLockDictionary.LockPermissions.html#valueOf-java.lang.String-
PdfSigFieldLockDictionary.LockPermissions	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Enumerates the different levels of access permissions granted for the document when the corresponding signature field is signed: NO_CHANGES_ALLOWED - no changes to the document are     permitted; any change to the document invalidates the signature,FORM_FILLING - permitted changes are filling in forms,     instantiating page templates, and signing; other changes invalidate     the signature,FORM_FILLING_AND_ANNOTATION - permitted changes are the     same as for the previous, as well as annotation creation, deletion,     and modification; other changes invalidate the signature.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/forms/PdfSigFieldLockDictionary.LockPermissions.html

PdfSignature isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfSignature.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfSignatureAppDictionary isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfSignatureAppDictionary.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfSignatureAppearance setImageScale	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the scaling to be applied to the background image. If it's zero the image will fully fill the rectangle. If it's less than zero the image will fill the rectangle but will keep the proportions. If it's greater than zero that scaling will be applied. In any of the cases the image will always be centered. It's zero by default.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfSignatureAppearance.html#setImageScale-float-

PdfSigner getSignatureAppearance	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Provides access to a signature appearance object. Use it to customize the appearance of the signature. <p> Be aware: <ul><li>If you create new signature field (either use <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfSigner.html#setFieldName-java.lang.String-"><code>setFieldName(java.lang.String)</code></a> with the name that doesn't exist in the document or don't specify it at all) then the signature is invisible by default.</li><li>If you sign already existing field, then the signature appearance object is modified to have all the properties (page num., rect etc.) consistent with the state of the field (<strong>if you customized the appearance object before the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfSigner.html#setFieldName-java.lang.String-"><code>setFieldName(java.lang.String)</code></a> call you'll have to do it again</strong>)</li></ul></p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfSigner.html#getSignatureAppearance--

PdfSpecialCs flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#makeIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code></a>. PdfSpecialCs isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfSpecialCs.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfString	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A PdfString-class is the PDF-equivalent of a JAVA-String-object.  A string is a sequence of characters delimited by parenthesis. If a string is too long to be conveniently placed on a single line, it may be split across multiple lines by using the backslash character (\) at the end of a line to indicate that the string continues on the following line. Within a string, the backslash character is used as an escape to specify unbalanced parenthesis, non-printing ASCII characters, and the backslash character itself. Use of the \ddd escape sequence is the preferred way to represent characters outside the printable ASCII character set. This object is described in the 'Portable Document Format Reference Manual version 1.7' section 3.2.3 (page 53-56). PdfObject</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfString.html
PdfStringDestination isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/navigation/PdfStringDestination.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfTargetDictionary isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/action/PdfTargetDictionary.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfTextArray	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>PdfTextArray defines an array with displacements and PdfString-objects.  A PdfTextArray is used with the operator TJ in PdfCanvas. PdfTextMarkupAnnotation createHighLight	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a text markup annotation of highlight style subtype. <p> IMPORTANT NOTE on <b>quadPoints</b> argument: According to Table 179 in ISO 32000-1, the QuadPoints array lists the vertices in counterclockwise order and the text orientation is defined by the first and second vertex. This basically means QuadPoints is specified as lower-left, lower-right, top-right, top-left. HOWEVER, Adobe's interpretation (tested at least with Acrobat 10, Acrobat 11, Reader 11) is top-left, top-right, lower-left, lower-right (Z-shaped order). This means that if the QuadPoints array is specified according to the standard, the rendering is not as expected. Other viewers seem to follow Adobe's interpretation. Hence we recommend to use and expect QuadPoints array in Z-order, just as Acrobat and probably most other viewers expect.</p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfTextMarkupAnnotation.html#createHighLight-com.itextpdf.kernel.geom.Rectangle-float:A-

This basically means QuadPoints is specified as lower-left, lower-right, top-right, top-left. HOWEVER, Adobe's interpretation (tested at least with Acrobat 10, Acrobat 11, Reader 11) is top-left, top-right, lower-left, lower-right (Z-shaped order). This means that if the QuadPoints array is specified according to the standard, the rendering is not as expected. Other viewers seem to follow Adobe's interpretation. Hence we recommend to use and expect QuadPoints array in Z-order, just as Acrobat and probably most other viewers expect.</p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfTextMarkupAnnotation.html#createUnderline-com.itextpdf.kernel.geom.Rectangle-float:A-

PdfType3Font	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Low-level API class for Type 3 fonts.  In Type 3 fonts, glyphs are defined by streams of PDF graphics operators. These streams are associated with character names. A separate encoding entry maps character codes to the appropriate character names for the glyphs.  To be able to be wrapped with this PdfObjectWrapper the PdfObject must be indirect.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/font/PdfType3Font.html

RandomAccessFileOrArray read	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Reads a single byte</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/RandomAccessFileOrArray.html#read--
RandomAccessFileOrArray readShortLE	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Reads a signed 16-bit number from this stream in little-endian order. The method reads two bytes from this stream, starting at the current stream pointer. If the two bytes read, in order, are <code>b1</code> and <code>b2</code>, where each of the two values is between <code>0</code> and <code>255</code>, inclusive, then the result is equal to: <blockquote><pre>     (short)((b2 &lt;&lt; 8) | b1) </pre></blockquote><p> This method blocks until the two bytes are read, the end of the stream is detected, or an exception is thrown.</p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/RandomAccessFileOrArray.html#readShortLE--
RandomAccessFileOrArray readUnsignedShortLE	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Reads an unsigned 16-bit number from this stream in little-endian order. This method reads two bytes from the stream, starting at the current stream pointer. If the bytes read, in order, are <code>b1</code> and <code>b2</code>, where <code>0 &lt;= b1, b2 &lt;= 255</code>, then the result is equal to: <blockquote><pre>     (b2 &lt;&lt; 8) | b1 </pre></blockquote><p> This method blocks until the two bytes are read, the end of the stream is detected, or an exception is thrown.</p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/RandomAccessFileOrArray.html#readUnsignedShortLE--
RandomAccessFileOrArray readCharLE	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Reads a Unicode character from this stream in little-endian order. This method reads two bytes from the stream, starting at the current stream pointer. If the bytes read, in order, are <code>b1</code> and <code>b2</code>, where <code>0 &lt;= b1, b2 &lt;= 255</code>, then the result is equal to: <blockquote><pre>     (char)((b2 &lt;&lt; 8) | b1) </pre></blockquote><p> This method blocks until the two bytes are read, the end of the stream is detected, or an exception is thrown.</p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/RandomAccessFileOrArray.html#readCharLE--
RandomAccessFileOrArray readIntLE	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Reads a signed 32-bit integer from this stream in little-endian order. This method reads 4 bytes from the stream, starting at the current stream pointer. If the bytes read, in order, are <code>b1</code>, <code>b2</code>, <code>b3</code>, and <code>b4</code>, where <code>0 &lt;= b1, b2, b3, b4 &lt;= 255</code>, then the result is equal to: <blockquote><pre>     (b4 &lt;&lt; 24) | (b3 &lt;&lt; 16) + (b2 &lt;&lt; 8) + b1 </pre></blockquote><p> This method blocks until the four bytes are read, the end of the stream is detected, or an exception is thrown.</p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/RandomAccessFileOrArray.html#readIntLE--
RandomAccessFileOrArray readUnsignedInt	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Reads an unsigned 32-bit integer from this stream. This method reads 4 bytes from the stream, starting at the current stream pointer. If the bytes read, in order, are <code>b1</code>, <code>b2</code>, <code>b3</code>, and <code>b4</code>, where <code>0 &lt;= b1, b2, b3, b4 &lt;= 255</code>, then the result is equal to: <blockquote><pre>     (b1 &lt;&lt; 24) | (b2 &lt;&lt; 16) + (b3 &lt;&lt; 8) + b4 </pre></blockquote><p> This method blocks until the four bytes are read, the end of the stream is detected, or an exception is thrown.</p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/RandomAccessFileOrArray.html#readUnsignedInt--

RandomAccessSourceFactory createSource	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/IRandomAccessSource.html" title="interface in com.itextpdf.io.source"><code>IRandomAccessSource</code></a> based on a URL.  The data available at the URL is read into memory and used as the source for the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/IRandomAccessSource.html" title="interface in com.itextpdf.io.source"><code>IRandomAccessSource</code></a></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/RandomAccessSourceFactory.html#createSource-java.net.URL-
RandomAccessSourceFactory createSource	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/IRandomAccessSource.html" title="interface in com.itextpdf.io.source"><code>IRandomAccessSource</code></a> based on an <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/InputStream.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.io"><code>InputStream</code></a>.  The full content of the InputStream is read into memory and used as the source for the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/IRandomAccessSource.html" title="interface in com.itextpdf.io.source"><code>IRandomAccessSource</code></a></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/RandomAccessSourceFactory.html#createSource-java.io.InputStream-
RandomAccessSourceFactory createBestSource	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/IRandomAccessSource.html" title="interface in com.itextpdf.io.source"><code>IRandomAccessSource</code></a> based on a filename string. If the filename describes a URL, a URL based source is created If the filename describes a file on disk, the contents may be read into memory (if <code>forceRead</code> is true), opened using memory mapped file channel (if usePlainRandomAccess is false), or opened using <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/RandomAccessFile.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.io"><code>RandomAccessFile</code></a> access (if usePlainRandomAccess is true) This call will automatically fail over to using <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/RandomAccessFile.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.io"><code>RandomAccessFile</code></a> if the memory map operation fails</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/RandomAccessSourceFactory.html#createBestSource-java.lang.String-
RandomAccessSourceFactory createBestSource	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/IRandomAccessSource.html" title="interface in com.itextpdf.io.source"><code>IRandomAccessSource</code></a> based on memory mapping a file channel. Unless you are explicitly working with a <code>FileChannel</code> already, it is better to use <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/RandomAccessSourceFactory.html#createBestSource-java.lang.String-"><code>createBestSource(String)</code></a>. If the file is large, it will be opened using a paging strategy.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/RandomAccessSourceFactory.html#createBestSource-java.nio.channels.FileChannel-

RoundDotsBorder draw	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><p> All borders are supposed to be drawn in such way, that inner content of the element is on the right from the drawing direction. Borders are drawn in this order: top, right, bottom, left. </p><p> Given points specify the line which lies on the border of the content area, therefore the border itself should be drawn to the left from the drawing direction. </p><p><code>borderWidthBefore</code> and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> parameters are used to define the widths of the borders that are before and after the current border, e.g. for the bottom border, <code>borderWidthBefore</code> specifies width of the right border and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> - width of the left border. Those width are used to handle areas of border joins. </p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/border/RoundDotsBorder.html#draw-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.PdfCanvas-float-float-float-float-float-float-

SolidBorder draw	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><p> All borders are supposed to be drawn in such way, that inner content of the element is on the right from the drawing direction. Borders are drawn in this order: top, right, bottom, left. </p><p> Given points specify the line which lies on the border of the content area, therefore the border itself should be drawn to the left from the drawing direction. </p><p><code>borderWidthBefore</code> and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> parameters are used to define the widths of the borders that are before and after the current border, e.g. for the bottom border, <code>borderWidthBefore</code> specifies width of the right border and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> - width of the left border. Those width are used to handle areas of border joins. </p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/border/SolidBorder.html#draw-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.PdfCanvas-float-float-float-float-float-float-

See also <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#setSkipLastFooter-boolean-"><code>setSkipLastFooter(boolean)</code></a>.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#addFooterCell-java.lang.String-

Used when printing tables in succession belonging to the same printed table aspect.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#setSkipFirstHeader-boolean-

Table createRendererSubTree	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a renderer subtree with root in the current table element. Compared to <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#getRenderer--"><code>getRenderer()</code></a>, the renderer returned by this method should contain all the child renderers for children of the current element.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#createRendererSubTree--
Table getRenderer	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Gets a table renderer for this element. Note that this method can be called more than once. By default each element should define its own renderer, but the renderer can be overridden by <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/AbstractElement.html#setNextRenderer-com.itextpdf.layout.renderer.IRenderer-"><code>AbstractElement.setNextRenderer(IRenderer)</code></a> method call.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#getRenderer--
Table isComplete	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from interface: <code><a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/ILargeElement.html#isComplete--">ILargeElement</a></code></b></div><br><div class="block">Checks whether an element has already been marked as complete.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#isComplete--
Table complete	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Indicates that all the desired content has been added to this large element. After this method is called, more precise rendering is activated. For instance, a table may have a <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#setSkipLastFooter-boolean-"><code>setSkipLastFooter(boolean)</code></a> method set to true, and in case of large table on <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#flush--"><code>flush()</code></a> we do not know if any more content will be added, so we might not place the content in the bottom of the page where it would fit, but instead add a footer, and place that content in the start of the page. Technically such result would look all right, but it would be more concise if we placed the content in the bottom and did not start new page. For such cases to be renderered more accurately, one can call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#complete--"><code>complete()</code></a> when some content is still there and not flushed.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#complete--
Table flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Writes the newly added content to the document.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#flush--
Table flushContent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Flushes the content which has just been added to the document. This is a method for internal usage and is called automatically by the docunent.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#flushContent--

We cannot write a large element into several documents simultaneously because we would need more bulky interfaces for this feature. For now we went for simplicity.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#setDocument-com.itextpdf.layout.Document-

Table	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A Table is a layout element that represents data in a two-dimensional grid. It is filled with cells, ordered in rows and columns.  It is an implementation of ILargeElement, which means it can be flushed to the canvas, in order to reclaim memory that is locked up.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html

TableRenderer layout	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">This method simulates positioning of the renderer, including all of its children, and returns the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>LayoutResult</code></a>, representing the layout result, including occupied area, status, i.e. if there was enough place to fit the renderer subtree, etc. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/LayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>LayoutResult</code></a> can be extended to return custom layout results for custom elements, e.g. <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/TextRenderer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.renderer"><code>TextRenderer</code></a> uses <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/layout/TextLayoutResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.layout"><code>TextLayoutResult</code></a> as its result. This method can be called standalone to learn how much area the renderer subtree needs, or can be called before <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/IRenderer.html#draw-com.itextpdf.layout.renderer.DrawContext-"><code>IRenderer.draw(DrawContext)</code></a>, to prepare the renderer to be flushed to the output stream.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/TableRenderer.html#layout-com.itextpdf.layout.layout.LayoutContext-

The logic which defines if tag belongs to the page is described at <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagStructureContext.html#flushPageTags-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfPage-"><code>flushPageTags(PdfPage)</code></a>.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagStructureContext.html#removePageTags-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfPage-
TagStructureContext moveTagPointerToTag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the tag, which is connected with the given accessible element, as a current tag for the given <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils"><code>TagTreePointer</code></a>. An exception will be thrown, if given accessible element is not connected to any tag.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagStructureContext.html#moveTagPointerToTag-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils.IAccessibleElement-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils.TagTreePointer-
TagStructureContext removeAllConnectionsToTags	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Destroys all the retained connections.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagStructureContext.html#removeAllConnectionsToTags--
TagStructureContext flushPageTags	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Flushes the tags which are considered to belong to the given page. The logic that defines if the given tag (structure element) belongs to the page is the following: if all the marked content references (dictionary or number references), that are the descenders of the given structure element, belong to the current page - the tag is considered to belong to the page. If tag has descenders from several pages - it is flushed, if all other pages except the current one are flushed. <br><br> If some of the page's tags are still connected to the accessible elements, in this case these tags are considered as not yet finished ones, and they won't be flushed.</br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagStructureContext.html#flushPageTags-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfPage-
TagStructureContext normalizeDocumentRootTag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Transforms root tags in a way that complies with the PDF References. <br/><br/> PDF Reference 10.7.3 Grouping Elements: <br/><br/> For most content extraction formats, the document must be a tree with a single top-level element; the structure tree root (identified by the StructTreeRoot entry in the document catalog) must have only one child in its K (kids) array. If the PDF file contains a complete document, the structure type Document is recommended for this top-level element in the logical structure hierarchy. If the file contains a well-formed document fragment, one of the structure types Part, Art, Sect, or Div may be used instead.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagStructureContext.html#normalizeDocumentRootTag--
TagStructureContext actualizeTagsProperties	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Method for internal usages. Essentially, all it does is just making sure that for connected tags properties are up to date with connected accessible elements properties.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagStructureContext.html#actualizeTagsProperties--
TagStructureContext	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>TagStructureContext class is used to track necessary information of document's tag structure. It is also used to make some global modifications of the tag tree like removing or flushing page tags, however these two methods and also others are called automatically and are for the most part for internal usage.  There shall be only one instance of this class per PdfDocument. To obtain instance of this class use PdfDocument.getTagStructureContext().</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagStructureContext.html
TagTreePointer setPageForTagging	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets a page which content will be tagged with this instance of <code>TagTreePointer</code>. To tag page content: <ol><li>Set pointer position to the tag which will be the parent of the page content item;</li><li>Call <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#getTagReference--"><code>getTagReference()</code></a> to obtain the reference to the current tag;</li><li>Pass <code>PdfTagReference</code> to the <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/PdfCanvas.html#openTag-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils.TagReference-"><code>PdfCanvas.openTag(TagReference)</code></a> method of the page's <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/PdfCanvas.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas"><code>PdfCanvas</code></a> to start marked content item;</li><li>Draw content on <code>PdfCanvas</code>;</li><li>Use <a href="http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/PdfCanvas.html#closeTag--"><code>PdfCanvas.closeTag()</code></a> to finish marked content item.</li></ol></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#setPageForTagging-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfPage-
TagTreePointer setContentStreamForTagging	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sometimes, tags are desired to be connected with the content that resides not in the page's content stream, but rather in the some appearance stream or in the form xObject stream. In that case, to have a valid tag structure, one shall set not only the page, on which the content will be rendered, but also the content stream in which the tagged content will reside. <br><br> NOTE: It's important to set a <code>null</code> for this value, when tagging of this stream content is finished.</br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#setContentStreamForTagging-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfStream-
